attribute-definition.description: JSON or other usable format with appropriate data
default is UTF-8
The file to export to, the following placeholders are allowed: {{timestamp format="yyyMMdd"}}
The folder to export to, should always start with 'IMPEX/'

custom-type.description: This custom object is used to manage each of the individual Scene 7 recipe definitions for a given recipe category / view-type combination.

key-definition.description: Describes the primary-key of a given recipe definition.

attribute-definition.description: Describes the name of the recipe category associated to a given recipe definition.
Describes the key / value pairs that represent the recipe definition in JSON format.
Describes the JSON document that contains the Image Orientation preferences for a given recipe.
Represents the recipe-segment of the Scene 7 image url that can be applied to multiple product variant representations.
Describes the sample url that should render an example of a given recipe definition.
Describes the user that last made a change to a given recipe definition.
Describes the recipe view type associated to a given recipe definition.

custom-type.description: This custom object is used to archive product image assignment requests make to master product definitions using the Scene 7 Recipe Assignment Tool Set.

key-definition.description: Describes the unique identifier for each product / image assignment record.

attribute-definition.description: Describes the collection of image assignments applied to a given master product.
Describes the style or material code to which the collection of image assignments will be applied.
Describes the site to which a given product / image assignment document is associated.
Describes the name of the Business Manager user that performed the product / image assignment.

custom-type.description: This custom object is used to define each of the Scene 7 recipe categories available to the current Demandware instance.

attribute-definition.description: Provides a description / overview for a given recipe category and how it is used.
Describes the order in which recipe categories are displayed.

custom-type.description: This custom object is used to audit changes made to a given Scene 7 recipe definition.

key-definition.description: Describes the unique identifier for a given recipe definition history record.

attribute-definition.description: Describes the name of the recipe category associated to a given recipe definition.
Describes the key / value pairs that represent the recipe definition in JSON format.
Describes the JSON document that contains the Image Orientation preferences for a given recipe.
Represents the recipe-segment of the Scene 7 image url that can be applied to multiple product variant representations.
Describes the primary key for a given recipeCategory / recipeViewType Scene 7 recipe definition.
Describes the sample url that should render an example of a given recipe definition.
Describes the site through which a given recipe definition change was made.
Describes the user that made the recorded change to a recipe definition.
Describes the recipe view type associated to a given recipe definition.

custom-type.description: This custom object will be used to store all initial recipe view-type definitions. These definitions should mirror the catalog image-types for a given site.

key-definition.description: The viewTypeID represents the external primary-key for a given view type.

attribute-definition.description: Describes the active status for a given view-type record (true = active, false = in-active / not in use).
Provides a summary and purpose for a given view-type and recipe display template.
Describes the device that a given view-type is designed to cater to (mobile, tablet, or desktop).
Describes the default height for a given image view-type.
Describes the default image-format for a given view-type (ex. png-alpha, jpg, etc).
Describes the image-preference for a given view-type (ex. model, product, lay-down, etc).
Describes the internal / merchant-facing name for a given image view-type.
Describes the page that a given image view-type would be visible on (ex. product-grid, product-detail, home-page, etc).
Describes the order / sequence in which view-types should be displayed.
Describes the default width (in pixels) for a given view-type.

key-definition.description: Event ID of the analytic activity being tracked

attribute-definition.description: Analytic fields, data attributes, etc, should all be defined and mapped here.
Custom event name that is sent to Marketing Cloud
Analytic event description

key-definition.description: Export ID mapped from job in Business Manager

attribute-definition.description: Export description
Export fields, data attributes, etc, should all be defined and mapped here.

custom-type.description: Tracks the last export for each feed to Marketing Cloud
Triggers defined for use with int_marketing_cloud cartridge.

attribute-definition.description: External Key of the entry event send definition.
Description of what this trigger event does
If unchecked, the trigger is disabled, in which case no communication is issued.
Subscriber profile fields, data extension attributes, etc, should all be defined and mapped here.

custom-type.description: Create CombinePDP catalog XML file for import

attribute-definition.description: Master ID's to combine

custom-type.description: Custom object to store return label email requests data. It'll be processed through a job and will be deleted after processing.

attribute-definition.display-name: Base 64 Encoded Return Label File Data
attribute-definition.description: Base 64 encoded return label file data received from FedEx/Canada post
Return label file type
Return label URL uploaded on Amazon S3. The file data will be uploaded to Amazon S3 through job and generated URL will be stored in this field
Required data to make SFMC service calls to send return label emails

custom-type.description: Custom Objects for News Letter Sign Up Job

attribute-definition.description: Whether Cart Placement Tag is Enabled
Data Key of On-site messaging placement tag for Cart Page.
Whether PDP Placement Tag is Enabled
Data Key of On-site messaging placement tag for PDP Page.
URL to On-Site Messaging Library URL
Switches the location of the Name to above or below the Jersey Number. Default (None) is Below the Number.
